artist: Artist: Nathan Carter; Artist: Dan Estabrook
creditline: The Mary and Robyn Campbell Fund for Art Books
description: turquoise blue paper covered album bound with three pink screws; cover is title page/colophon printed in black typeface; 12 black and white photo prints adhered to turquoise paper pages which are sprayed with pink pigment; pages are separated by spiderweb embossed glassine sheets; subject of photos is a person (Nathan Carter) wearing messy wig, black tights, heels, costume fingernails, in a variety of poses
medium: 24 hand sprayed pages, 12 archival pigment prints, cardboard, paper, fabric, anodized Chicago screws
signed: at BC, front cover: rth[illegible] / DES[illegible]
text: As a collaborative book project nurtured between two artists–one who identifies as a straight, cisgender, male photographer, and the other as a nonbinary interdisciplinary artist–this vividly hued and imaginatively constructed book also reflects a decades-long friendship founded in the punk and skateboarding scenes in Boston, MA. As such, the book itself is a kind of portrait within a portrait: a depiction of one artist’s journey into fuller self-awareness and gender identification, and an intimate portrayal of a platonic relationship between two ardent collaborators, both of whom are eager to create space for relationships that are so uneasily categorized.
title: M A R S The Goddess of Sex and Death
